ygData.subject: Re: Guilds (was Twinking...)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I think the main problem with mine and Faras s guild is that for quite some time, they invited in anyone who asked, so people who are mostly solo ers got
ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 1 Dec 1999, Ken Bachman wrote:

> From: Ken Bachman <kbachman@...>
>
> Mike Roach wrote:
> >
> > From: Mike Roach <mike.roach@...>
> >
> > Even though I really like our guild Robynn, I have learned not to rely on
> > them for anything. I realize your not saying that you do...but if I find
> > myself grouped with a guildmate its usually because of coincidence. No one
> > from our guild has ever come to my aid because I asked, only if it was
> > convenient.
> >
> > Faras Tar'Linedhel
> > Half-Elf Bard
> > E'ci
> > ______________________________
>
> This is kind of a shame; maybe you need a new guild. I spent a lot of the last

I think the main problem with mine and Faras's guild is that for quite
some time, they invited in anyone who asked, so people who are mostly
solo'ers got in and really don't participate in the guild. The main
players in the guild are a group of friends from MN, and while they
are very friendly, they seem to keep to themselves a lot. I have, on
occasion, gotten great deals on items and even some for free...but so
far that's about all the guild's been good for. Until I find a guild
on our server that is truly what I'm looking for (or break down and
try to make it myself), I'm content to have it the way it is. I do
ask on guild if anyone wants to join a group when I'm looking for
replacements, but I rarely get any answers. Oh, and Faras, the third
person in my regular group is a member of the guild, but has the same
beefs with it I do.

Anyone on E'ci know anyone who wants to help start a guild? =)

Robynn...happily procrastinating on her final project.

--
Katy Westerman Don't lick something unless
katyw@... you really mean it.
http://www.cs.ucr.edu/~katyw -Advice from the Naked
CS/Comp Math Major, UC Riverside Dancing Llama
